text: Gorgeous Song... Games were so so though. This one is really memorable and soothing...
author: Vaseem Baig

text: I love this soundtrack for completely different reason to everyone else. I wish to play this game one day.
author: Konradix05

text: No problem. Anyways, I think I shall go and take a look at the tracks you mentioned :) So thanks for the suggestions. Always nice to be introduced to new VGM tracks indeed.
author: Xzaithyr Grymhart

text: I found this a bit to repetitive to play all at one time. I got partway through the seashore before I saw how many floors I still had left to go, and decided to take a break. Still, it was a fun game, and I think I'll go back and finish it someday.
author: Sayeth Di Puppeth

text: Apparently I was one of the few that liked this one over the first one, to me there is a lot more to do and all of it is well done.  I do like the georama of the first one a bit better.
author: Matt 6418

text: I really love this game, the Dark Cloud series one of the best dungeon-crawling RPGs to grace the PS2
author: Masamune Okami

text: I personally prefer the first game for the atmosphere brought by the soundtrack which, in my opinion, surpasses the sequel. DC2 however is as you say a lot more polished than its predecessor and it offers much more in terms of gameplay and dynamics, though its soundtrack is rather weak and falls in repetitiveness pretty quickly. Not to mention the fact that the released OST sounds one step higher than in-game without the background ambiance, which is shamefully a pretty empty experience.
author: KK Slider

text: Damn, I still haven't gotten this game. I think this music might have been from the section in the demo I played of Dark Cloud 2.
author: GameBeatenakaKevinS

text: Just echoing what everyone else has said, but amazing game, definitely one of the best on ps2.
author: Ragnarokender

text: Oh man I love this game so much. I put a good 100 hours into this. I wish Level 5 would make a sequel. Or at least port this to the PS Vita. I'd even pay $50 again. Great great game.
author: Austin L

text: im actually surprised alot of people know and love this game. probably my fav game of all time.
author: dissident93

text: one of the best rpg on ps2 :)
author: Mathieu Chevalier

text: OMG Orphen XD I have that around here somewhere, have to dig it up and play again. So bad that it's good XD
author: Pogopuschel

text: This game was pretty damn amazing. I easily put in 60 or 70 hours into it. The music is beautiful. My only real complaint was that I felt the story was portrayed a bit moire childishly than the first one.
author: OldManShane

text: I remember Orphen! God that game was so weirdly bad! But now when I play it I actually really appreciate it's unique battle system and overall gameplay. Also the atmosphere was pretty good imo. I feel like if it had some more polish it could have been legitimately good!
author: biskwikman

text: I like it!
author: McBuffenFitness

text: Still remains one of the best games I have ever played. This game deserved so much more love!
author: Bruno Santos

text: I actually just started playing this game a week or two ago after playing the first one years ago. Loving it right now.
author: TidusTheGame

text: From every RPG to shooter to even board games, this is my favorite game of all time and I will never get rid of my copy of this game. My childhood is revived everytime I play this game. Thank you Supradarky
author: 203ltachl203

text: And while you're at it, bring Dragon Quest VIII and Rogue Galaxy (both from the same developer) as well!
author: LinkMarioSamus

text: It seems to me that with RPG soundtracks, the Forest Themes are the best tunes. I have a long... list of Forest themes I really enjoy.
author: Bahob the Warrior

text: Not to sound rude, but it's kind of a thing around here. Supra doesn't take suggestions, you just wait and see what kind of epic song he uploads next. ;)
author: Xzaithyr Grymhart

text: Both this & the original NEED to be re-released on PSN at some point
author: Vhyper1985

text: Every single tune from this game reminds me of the time I spent playing it with a close friend of mine.  She's moving across the country soon, so those memories are becoming all the more precious.
author: BlackBass08

text:
Oh man.
This
Game.

author: Eluzai

text: Oh man, sooo soo good!  I've played through this game... so many times.  The soundtrack was *spot on* for the steampunk/fantasy/sci-fi setting.
author: JavaSplice555

text: Love this game
author: Everlasting

text:
While I agree with the awesomeness of Dark Cloud. Dark Cloud 2.... was absolutely my favorite.  And you know what is funny that you post this now... I just finished my LP episodes of Forest of Rainbow Butterflies on my channel for this game! xD
Its weird how you start doing stuff like that and a bunch of your favorite places / people post / do stuff about it! GAH THIS.... AH <3
author: Corehoofify

text: Oh i loved this game as a kid. I remember having it on my PS2 and i had no memory card so every night i played it i just played to see how far i could get without saving. I always got a little bit further. That were the good old days. Must have been 9 years ago. But damn i loved the game so bad even tho i never finished it. And the music have always been stuck in my head since then. Such a lovely soundtrack and such an awesome atmosphere in the game. Thanks for uploading this!
author: PICE8Bit

text: the first had Way better ost
author: Brent Steeves

text: Dark Cloud was awesome! It totally had some of the most fitting tunes in gaming IMO :)
author: LMWYBC1996

text: Funny how I somehow preferred the first game, even if Dark Cloud 2 is way more polished. It probably has to do with DC being one of the first great games I played on the new generation, following a mediocre launch lineup of RPGs (Orphen anyone?). This game's﻿ cel shaded graphics aged very well, I must say. Oh and another soundtrack with unlooped ~1 min tracks, I hate that!
author: SupraDarky
